page.title: 09FURZEFIELD FIRST SCHOOL
page.content: Merstham's history started before Domesday.In 1950, L.C.C. rehoused some victims of London bombings on a large estate.These houses contrasted with the old,some dating from 1600. Soon the existing school was inadequate.In September 1954,{ {Furzefield Infants School}was opened.The roll was 266,rapidly increasing to 375.In 1972 it was reorganized as a First School with 203 Children.The roll is now 81.The recent policy of selling Council Houses has attracted new families.In April 1986,the roll will be 103.The adjoining Middle School has changed similarly. {OAKLEY.(Merstham Youth and Community {Centre.)}Near school is a large house called Oakley whose origins as a manor
